title: Proper JG Path for J4? (Yes I'm New)
body:
I can't find a cut and dry answer about the safest path for Jarvan in J4.

Even with a leash I'm almost dead if not a hit or two from death by the time I finish off blue buff (with or without Gromp's poison aura). I have the runes and masteries down (I think?) but I can't help but think I'm missing some sort of crucial detail. Even when I get a smite on Krug for Heavy Hands I'm struggling.

What am I doing wrong here? Lay it on me. Also build pointers arw welcome.

If anyone would like to add me for sake of teaching me the ropes be my guest.

replies.body:
I usually do Krugs (Smite)  - Raptor - Scuttle - Red (Smite) Then wolves - Gromp (Smite) - Blue

I would highly recommend doing scuttle though, it doesn't fight back and it procs your jungle item, meaning you can get a sizable amount of health back from just one scuttle. 

Just learn the general routes of the opposing jungler, they are usually pretty telegraph. For example, if you're up against a Rengar, you know he'll be starting his Red most likely since he gains absolutely nothing starting blue side his jungle, meaning taking the scuttle on the other side is almost always safe. 

If you get to the other side and scuttle is still there, that means they moved to the other side of their jungle with no intentions of taking the scuttle, meaning its usually safe, but always be wary. 

Mind telling me your masteries and runes? Those have a big impact as well.

Someone was telling me how Shaco couldn't full clear for shit, but I found out that if you ran the right masteries, you could full clear with him losing almost no health.  Just an example of what I'm talking about. Those make a huge difference.

Thank you very much! This will help a lot.

9x Mark of Attack

9x Seal of Armor

9x Glyph of Magic Resist

3x Quints of Atk Damage/Attack Speed

I follow the masteries for him that they have displayed on champion.gg

Looks like your runes are good, 

I would be a little bit careful about following champion.gg and mobafire, the people that put those guides together are still adapting to new jungle. 

I.E. to refer back to my last example, I can full clear with Shaco because I take the 2% lifesteal and spell vamp in offensive tree (whatever it is called.)
If I remember correctly when I checked (which was a week ago granted.), the top rate guide for him does not recommend it, and also cites saying it is difficult to full clear with Shaco which not even remotely true.

Just look through the entire mastery system, read all the perks, and try to understand and figure out why they recommend the set up they do. More importantly, would it work best with J4 and the skill level you have? J4 might be difficult to figure most optimal set up though, he can go either offensive or defensive with his set up.
I'm trying to play Jarvan aggressively but always edging on my teammates to help them make the successful jump.

that sounds about right in the new jungle. i would suggest starting strong side for a better leash, if you insist on starting blue bluff side even if it's the weak side, go for scuttle right after blue and you should be able to take wolves after with remaining health.

recall and get hunters potion. also you should start machete if you don't already.

I usually start with:

E (Flag?) Hunter's Machete and I do one of these:

Krug smite for heavy hands straight into Red or...

Gromp leashed into Blue

That's where I'm currently stuck- I feel like I'm doing something wrong from there. Is there a specific safe progression route that doesn't involve the scuttle? Or should I not worry about being caught out during the beginning of the game in river where scuttle is?

i would only worry about the battle over scuttle if your are against a stronger early game jungler (lee, xin, rek, elise, etc.). most junglers now have pretty low health after blue buff after starting gromp, in that case try starting at blue buff first instead.

if your strong side is on red buff, go krugs *smite* > chickens *no smite* > red buff *smite* you should live that just barely, the new refillable potion will be giving you 50 more hp too, I don't know if that will help.
